item.title: Eras of Computing
item.description: Eras of Computing Tabulating Era -> Programmable Computers -> Cognitive Computer System Era Tabulating Era (3000 BCE - 1940s CE) started w idea of storing and altering data simple calculations examples - abacus, difference engine, tabulating machine

item.title: Parallel vs Distributed Computing
item.description: #cloud #cloudcomputing parallel distributed single computer multiple computers many operations simultaneously system components are located at different locations multiple processors multiple computers shared or distributed memory ONLY distributed Processors communicate using bus computer communicate w each other through message passing improves sysem performance improves scalability, fault tolerance, resource sharing Serial Computing / Sequential Computing one task(operation/instruction) at a time, in sequence

item.title: 7 layers of OSI
item.description: Physical Data Link Network Transport Session Presentation Application example of calculator flowchart A--B--C--D--E--F--G A(Physical) B(Data Link) C(Network) D(Transport) E(Session) F(Presentation) G(Application) â€‹```

item.title: Cloud Computing Important Questions
item.description: Unit 1 5M Differentiate bw parallel and distributed computing Explain principles of parallel and distributed computing Write in detail the elements of distributed computing Write in detail the elements of parallel computing

item.title: Encryption
item.description: What is encryption? Encoding data to ensure that no one but the recipient can access/read using mathematical algorithms protecting it from malicious people

item.title: Hashing
item.description: Key value pair Hashtable indexable has 3 functions - insert (key,value) get (key) delete (key) signatures, cryptography, cybersecurity, data indexing data indexing

item.title: Public Key Infrastructure
item.description: A framework consisting of security policies, communication protocols, procedures, etc uses both symmetric and asymmetric How to trust a cloud?
